minItems.description: MinItems specifies that this field must have the specified number of items at a minimum

maxItems.description: MaxItems specifies that this field must have the specified number of items at a maximum

unique.description: Unique specifies that all elements in this field must be unique. This contraint is only applicable to scalar and enum types (messages are not supported).

items.description: Items specifies the contraints to be applied to each item in the field. Repeated message fields will still execute validation against each item unless skip is specified here.

ignoreEmpty.description: IgnoreEmpty specifies that the validation rules of this field should be evaluated only if the field is not empty

RepeatedRules.title: Repeated Rules
RepeatedRules.description: RepeatedRules describe the constraints applied to `repeated` values

required.description: Required specifies that this field must be set

in.description: In specifies that this field's `type_url` must be equal to one of the specified values.

notIn.description: NotIn specifies that this field's `type_url` must not be equal to any of the specified values.

validate.AnyRules.title: Any Rules
validate.AnyRules.description: AnyRules describe constraints applied exclusively to the `google.protobuf.Any` well-known type

const.description: Const specifies that this field must be exactly the specified value

validate.BoolRules.title: Bool Rules
validate.BoolRules.description: BoolRules describes the constraints applied to `bool` values

const.description: Const specifies that this field must be exactly the specified value

len.description: Len specifies that this field must be the specified number of bytes

minLen.description: MinLen specifies that this field must be the specified number of bytes at a minimum

maxLen.description: MaxLen specifies that this field must be the specified number of bytes at a maximum

pattern.description: Pattern specifes that this field must match against the specified regular expression (RE2 syntax). The included expression should elide any delimiters.

prefix.description: Prefix specifies that this field must have the specified bytes at the beginning of the string.

suffix.description: Suffix specifies that this field must have the specified bytes at the end of the string.

contains.description: Contains specifies that this field must have the specified bytes anywhere in the string.

in.description: In specifies that this field must be equal to one of the specified values

notIn.description: NotIn specifies that this field cannot be equal to one of the specified values

ip.description: Ip specifies that the field must be a valid IP (v4 or v6) address in byte format

ipv4.description: Ipv4 specifies that the field must be a valid IPv4 address in byte format

ipv6.description: Ipv6 specifies that the field must be a valid IPv6 address in byte format

ignoreEmpty.description: IgnoreEmpty specifies that the validation rules of this field should be evaluated only if the field is not empty

validate.BytesRules.description: BytesRules describe the constraints applied to `bytes` values

lt.description: Lt specifies that this field must be less than the specified value, exclusive

lte.description: Lte specifies that this field must be less than or equal to the specified value, inclusive

gt.description: Gt specifies that this field must be greater than the specified value, exclusive. If the value of Gt is larger than a specified Lt or Lte, the range is reversed.

gte.description: Gte specifies that this field must be greater than or equal to the specified value, inclusive. If the value of Gte is larger than a specified Lt or Lte, the range is reversed.

in.description: In specifies that this field must be equal to one of the specified values

notIn.description: NotIn specifies that this field cannot be equal to one of the specified values

ignoreEmpty.description: IgnoreEmpty specifies that the validation rules of this field should be evaluated only if the field is not empty

noSparse.description: NoSparse specifies values in this field cannot be unset. This only applies to map's with message value types.

keys.description: Keys specifies the constraints to be applied to each key in the field.

values.description: Values specifies the constraints to be applied to the value of each key in the field. Message values will still have their validations evaluated unless skip is specified here.

validate.MessageRules.description: MessageRules describe the constraints applied to embedded message values. For message-type fields, validation is performed recursively.

const.description: Const specifies that this field must be exactly the specified value

len.description: Len specifies that this field must be the specified number of characters (Unicode code points). Note that the number of characters may differ from the number of bytes in the string.

minLen.description: MinLen specifies that this field must be the specified number of characters (Unicode code points) at a minimum. Note that the number of characters may differ from the number of bytes in the string.

maxLen.description: MaxLen specifies that this field must be the specified number of characters (Unicode code points) at a maximum. Note that the number of characters may differ from the number of bytes in the string.

lenBytes.description: LenBytes specifies that this field must be the specified number of bytes

minBytes.description: MinBytes specifies that this field must be the specified number of bytes at a minimum

maxBytes.description: MaxBytes specifies that this field must be the specified number of bytes at a maximum

pattern.description: Pattern specifes that this field must match against the specified regular expression (RE2 syntax). The included expression should elide any delimiters.

prefix.description: Prefix specifies that this field must have the specified substring at the beginning of the string.

suffix.description: Suffix specifies that this field must have the specified substring at the end of the string.

contains.description: Contains specifies that this field must have the specified substring anywhere in the string.

notContains.description: NotContains specifies that this field cannot have the specified substring anywhere in the string.

in.description: In specifies that this field must be equal to one of the specified values

notIn.description: NotIn specifies that this field cannot be equal to one of the specified values

email.description: Email specifies that the field must be a valid email address as defined by RFC 5322

hostname.description: Hostname specifies that the field must be a valid hostname as defined by RFC 1034. This constraint does not support internationalized domain names (IDNs).

ip.description: Ip specifies that the field must be a valid IP (v4 or v6) address. Valid IPv6 addresses should not include surrounding square brackets.

ipv4.description: Ipv4 specifies that the field must be a valid IPv4 address.

ipv6.description: Ipv6 specifies that the field must be a valid IPv6 address. Valid IPv6 addresses should not include surrounding square brackets.

uri.description: Uri specifies that the field must be a valid, absolute URI as defined by RFC 3986

uriRef.description: UriRef specifies that the field must be a valid URI as defined by RFC 3986 and may be relative or absolute.

address.description: Address specifies that the field must be either a valid hostname as defined by RFC 1034 (which does not support internationalized domain names or IDNs), or it can be a valid IP (v4 or v6).

uuid.description: Uuid specifies that the field must be a valid UUID as defined by RFC 4122

strict.description: This applies to regexes HTTP_HEADER_NAME and HTTP_HEADER_VALUE to enable strict header validation. By default, this is true, and HTTP header validations are RFC-compliant. Setting to false will enable a looser validations that only disallows \r\n\0 characters, which can be used to bypass header matching rules.

ignoreEmpty.description: IgnoreEmpty specifies that the validation rules of this field should be evaluated only if the field is not empty

validate.StringRules.title: String Rules
validate.StringRules.description: StringRules describe the constraints applied to `string` values

required.description: Required specifies that this field must be set

const.description: Const specifies that this field must be exactly the specified value

lt.description: Lt specifies that this field must be less than the specified value, exclusive

lte.description: Lte specifies that this field must be less than the specified value, inclusive

gt.description: Gt specifies that this field must be greater than the specified value, exclusive

gte.description: Gte specifies that this field must be greater than the specified value, inclusive

ltNow.description: LtNow specifies that this must be less than the current time. LtNow can only be used with the Within rule.

gtNow.description: GtNow specifies that this must be greater than the current time. GtNow can only be used with the Within rule.

within.description: Within specifies that this field must be within this duration of the current time. This constraint can be used alone or with the LtNow and GtNow rules.

validate.TimestampRules.title: Timestamp Rules
validate.TimestampRules.description: TimestampRules describe the constraints applied exclusively to the `google.protobuf.Timestamp` well-known type

const.description: Const specifies that this field must be exactly the specified value

lt.description: Lt specifies that this field must be less than the specified value, exclusive

lte.description: Lte specifies that this field must be less than or equal to the specified value, inclusive

gt.description: Gt specifies that this field must be greater than the specified value, exclusive. If the value of Gt is larger than a specified Lt or Lte, the range is reversed.

gte.description: Gte specifies that this field must be greater than or equal to the specified value, inclusive. If the value of Gte is larger than a specified Lt or Lte, the range is reversed.

in.description: In specifies that this field must be equal to one of the specified values

notIn.description: NotIn specifies that this field cannot be equal to one of the specified values

ignoreEmpty.description: IgnoreEmpty specifies that the validation rules of this field should be evaluated only if the field is not empty
